repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
- Fixes 'autoindent' being applied during redo.
- Makes redoing a large paste significantly faster.
- Stores pasted text in the register being recorded.

Fix #28561

comment_data.body:
is it worth using a common prefix?
```suggestion
void paste_store(const TriState state, const String str, const bool crlf)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3182,3 +3189,121 @@ bool map_execute_lua(bool may_repeat)
   ga_clear(&line_ga);
   return true;
 }
+
+/// Appends pasted text to redo buffer and/or record buffer if needed.
+/// Escapes all K_SPECIAL and NUL bytes in the content.
+///
+/// @param state  kFalse for the start of a paste
+///               kTrue for the end of a paste
+///               kNone for the content of a paste
+/// @param str    the content of the paste (only used when state is kNone)
+void store_pasted_text(const TriState state, const String str, const bool crlf)

@@ -3182,3 +3189,121 @@ bool map_execute_lua(bool may_repeat)
   ga_clear(&line_ga);
   return true;
 }
+
+/// Appends pasted text to redo buffer and/or record buffer if needed.
+/// Escapes all K_SPECIAL and NUL bytes in the content.
+///
+/// @param state  kFalse for the start of a paste
+///               kTrue for the end of a paste
+///               kNone for the content of a paste
+/// @param str    the content of the paste (only used when state is kNone)
+void store_pasted_text(const TriState state, const String str, const bool crlf)

comment_data.body:
for grep:
```suggestion
    const int c = state == kFalse ? K_PS : K_PE; // <PasteStart>, <PasteEnd>
```
the `AppendCharToRedobuff` hacks were already attempting to "fixup" the input buffer, so arguably `paste_store` is just formalizing that. 👍

can we give a hint that mentions `<PasteStart>`. 

```suggestion
/// Handles <PasteStart>, repeats pasted text.
static void nv_paste(cmdarg_T *cap)
```

can we leave a hint about the intention of these keycodes, to emphasize that they are internal-only and not to be sent directly by UIs
```suggestion
  // Delimits pasted text (input from nvim_paste). Internal-only, not directly sent by UIs.
  { K_PS,              "PasteStart" },
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -184,6 +184,9 @@ static const struct key_name_entry {
   { K_KRIGHT,          "kRight" },
   { K_KRIGHT,          "KP6" },
 
+  { K_PS,              "PasteStart" },

comment_data.body: I can just remove these notations, so that UIs cannot send them.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -184,6 +184,9 @@ static const struct key_name_entry {
   { K_KRIGHT,          "kRight" },
   { K_KRIGHT,          "KP6" },
 
+  { K_PS,              "PasteStart" },

comment_data.body: I've removed these two notations. Maybe I should just rename them `K_PASTE_START` and `K_PASTE_END`?

comment_regular_data.body:
This PR makes redoing a large paste significantly faster. With the same build type and a 15MB log file:
- Before this PR, pasting the file takes several seconds, while redoing the paste takes over a minute (I didn't wait for the redo to finish).
- After this PR, both pasting the file and redoing the paste takes several seconds.
I added this to news.txt in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/30494 because this is a very nice improvement, even if it's technically a "bug fix".

title: fix(paste): improve repeating of pasted text
